meanings.definition: To cause disorder or turmoil in (a system, process, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction site can disrupt our peaceful afternoon.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected power outage disrupted the flow of the meeting.
meanings.sent3: Trying to cook dinner while dancing to music may disrupt your kitchen routine.
meanings.sent4: The mischievous squirrel disrupts the calm of the park with its acorn-throwing antics.
meanings.sent5: The sudden thunderstorm disrupts the tranquility of the picnic with its roaring thunder.

meanings.definition: To interrupt the normal progress or activity of (something)
meanings.sent1: Please do not disrupt the class by talking loudly during the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The phone call disrupted her train of thought while she was studying.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy disrupts the serious atmosphere of the office with its antics.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected visitor disrupts the flow of the carefully planned event.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock disrupts the peaceful silence of the morning with its loud ringing.
